a.name: Honda
a.description: One of Japan’s largest carmaker, Honda is also the world’s largest manufacturer of motorcycles and the internal combustion engines.

b.name: Civic
b.description: The iconic Honda Civic epitomizes compact-car excellence with its mix of practicality and a fun-to-drive personality.

a.name: Toyota
a.description: Toyota Motor Corporation is a multinational automaker headquartered in Toyota, Aichi, Japan. In 2010, Toyota employed 317,734 people worldwide, and was the world’s largest automobile manufacturer in 2012 by production.

a.name: General Motors (USA)
a.description: General Motors Company, commonly known as GM, formerly incorporated (until 2009) as General Motors Corporation
